newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Acacia mulls investment in Helix.
newsitem.headline: Acacia mulls investment in Helix.

text.p: Acacia Resources Ltd said on Thursday it would assess the future of its 19.9 percent stake in Gawler Craton gold explorer, Helix Resources Ltd.

Asked if the company was looking at its investment in Helix, Acacia's managing director, Michael Folie said: "Yes it is obviously a matter that has to be considered but at this stage we don't see any reason to revise what (value) we have it at."
Folie said at this point in time the company had not considered the issue of Helix's value.
"It depends on how the results emerge over the next period of time," he said.
Acacia acquired a 17.4 percent stake in Helix at an average price of A$4.20 per share and topped its interest up to the compulsory takeover threshold of 19.9 percent by mid-April.
Helix shares soared late last year after promising results from its Lake Everard project in the Gawler Craton region. But further drilling results have disappointed the market.
At 1.10 p.m (0310 GMT), Helix shares were 10 cents weaker at 85 cents, while Acacia stock was nine cents higher at A$1.47.
